Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

OOC: If I can be serious for a minute, this group is the epitome of serious=
ness and does not deserve to be subjected to a silly post. Prepare for the =
rebirth of the original rookie monster of NBW.

BIC:

Arrow hears Diesel's =
voice. His back was turned to his old ally. He tries to remember where he h=
ad seen Diesel before. Memories of his past come flying back to him. They r=
eturn easily when he needs them enough, he finds, the Radicons hadn't done =
a very good job of erasing these memories. He slowly turns around, recallin=
g Diesel's place in his tumultuous life.

Arrow: Ah, yes, Diesel, the messa=
ge. It has been a long time, hasn't it? Shall we get to business immediatel=
y?

Arrow could barely remember Razor. He didn't hold anything against the =
Radicons for damaging his memory so badly. They did what they had to, Arrow=
 had attempted to kill them.

Arrow: So, what now? Do we head to Earth?
~~~=
~~
Deemos was sitting in a meeting, bored.

Leader: Gentlemen, we must all =
band together and stop this menace! We cannot allow this other club to gain=
 the upper hand! We truly have the best flag! The others will pay for their=
 disagreeance!

Deemos: What kind of club is this? And is disagreeance a wo=
rd?

Leader: This is not a club, this is a council. It's the Council of Evi=
l. And yes, Disagreeance is a word.

Deemos: No, you said "We cannot allow =
this other club to gain the upper hand," apparently if there is this "other=
" club, this is a club.

Leader: See here--

Deemos: I was the one who held=
 a council. We were the Mafia, the most imposing group to ever exist save f=
or the Alliance.

Leader: Sir, I'm certain I don't know what you are talkin=
g about.

Deemos: If this so called council is so evil, why is it that we a=
re not attacking, and why is it that we are not spilling blood.

Leader: Me=
ch fluid.

Deemos: It's the same thing. I've spilled alot of it.

Leader: W=
ell, sir, you see, we like to bide our time, and then--

Deemos: Then you b=
urn someone else's flag. Then they come and burn yours. You don't know what=
 violence is. I am the epitome of violence. The innovator. The only individ=
uals I've seen you destroy are your own comrades. Not that it's a bad thing=
 to destroy your comrades, I've destroyed plenty of lackeys in my time.

Le=
ader: I think you're only saying this because you've joined another council=
! I think you need to be dealt with! You're nothing more than a vicious tra=
itor!

Deemos: So you guys are going to deal with me? Put me away? Send me =
to the great junkyard in the sky?

Member: Junkyard?

Leader: Enough of thi=
s, get him!

Deemos stands up. A member sitting right next to him stands up=
 as well, but he's too slow and too dumb. Deemos puts a pistol to his mid s=
ection quickly and fires. Several bolts rip through the robot, creating sev=
eral flashes and one hole leading all the way through. The unlucky one fall=
s to the ground. Deemos' trigger finger quickly flicks a switch on the util=
ity pistol as he swivels it around towards another member who was raising a=
 rifle. Deemos moves forward a single step and barely dodges a shot heading=
 his way. He fires the pistol and a barrage of 5 inch long steel nails are =
fired at rapid speed, piercing the head of the attackee and tearing off lar=
ge chunks. Deemos quickly spins around, flicking a switch once more and he =
fires. Several shots hit the robot who had fired at him, cutting down the b=
ot who shocked at Deemos' speed and severing one of his arms and his head. =
The cut down fellow's head rolled across the floor as the body dropped.

Le=
ader: Idiots!

Deemos quickly fired a few pellets on the ground, which erup=
ted into tall flames. He was hidden from sight. A shot emerges from behind =
the flames, passing Deemos' head by inches.

Leader: Did you hear that? I t=
hink I got him.

A grenade flies out from behind the fire and rolls near th=
e Leader of the council's feet.

(Cut to)

Deemos runs through the halls of=
 the building as a massive explosion erupts behind him, detonating the room=
 he previously occupied. It was no problem escaping from these buffoons, he=
 thought as he exited the building, laughing at the fact that he destroyed =
about 20 or so more lives. He decided to check his messages. His commlink s=
ystem was designed to capture messages and hold them for a later hearing. H=
e had two of these. He activated the first one.

Message: Hey, buddy, I got=
 some of those (buzz) were trying to get. It was (buzz) so, you wanna (buzz=
) we've--

Deemos deletes the message quickly. A wrong number and a bad com=
mlink. He activates the next message. He listens to the code carefully then=
 plays it back again. He plays it back a third time.

Deemos: Hmm. Maybe. T=
his sounds like the old code.

He activates his jets and flies, planning to=
 answer this message addressing him and the the one that he knew well back =
on Earth, Arrow. It had been a long time since he had come in contact with =
Razor. He was ready for anything...

  ----- Original Message -----
  From:=
 RoboRick007
  To: Neo Beast Wars
  Sent: Sunday, August 11, 2002 11:03 PM
=
  Subject: Secret Messages


  : : Diesel : :

  On Cybertron a fuel tanker=
 truck drives down an elevated street, before pulling into what looked like=
 an abandon building. The black and silver truck transformes into a menacin=
g Cybertronian. A Decepticon too be exact. He turns to the others in the bu=
ilding.

  Diesel: Hey Arrow, did you pick up that incoded transmission tha=
t came through the Transwarp portal?

  He awaits a response.

  : : Wolfen=
stein : :

  While he follows Megatron deeper into the base. His comm syste=
m picks up a transmission. However it is heavily incoded so he cannot liste=
n too it now. He sets his comm unit to work on it, and continues on.
------=_NextPart_000_002B_01C24198.B79AB8C0
